ext_descriptions.ext_description: The interpolation_type describes the method of interpolation between two configuration definitions of a kinematic structure.
an interpolation in which all pair parameters shall match the set of pair parameter values defined in the next configuration definition.
the pair parameters are changing abruptly.
an interpolation in which all pair parameters are interpolated such that the pair parameters pass from one value to the next one at the same rate. The rate may vary proportionally among the pairs.
an interpolation in which all pair parameters are interpolated such that the pair parameters pass from one value to the next one at the same rate. The rate remains constant.

A Circular_path is a type of . A Circular_path describes a portion of a complete
such that the interpolation rule gives a circle for the translational part of the motion of the origin of the frame of the . The interpolation for the orientation is performed in synchronous fashion with the interpolation of translation.
an intermediate point through which the Circular_path passes.

A Curve_based_path is a type of . A Curve_based_path describes a portion of a complete
such that the interpolation rule follows a curve for the translational part of the motion of the origin of the frame of the . The interpolation for the orientation is performed in synchronous fashion with the interpolation of translation.
the curve which defines the translational interpolation between the Path_nodes that are connected by the Curve_based_path.

A Curve_based_path_with_orientation is a type of . that controls both, the position and orientation of a link along curves. The origin of the link frame shall move along the position_curve. The orientation_curve in respect to the position_curve for the same parametrisation value specifies the z-direction of the link frame. The direction of the position_curve specifies the x-direction of the link frame. Both curves shall have the same parametrization and shall not touch or intersect each other.
specifies the curve along which the origin of the link frame is moved.
specifies the rotation of the link frame relative to the position_curve for the same parametrisation value.

The
referenced by position_curve shall match the
referenced by orientation_curve.
A Curve_based_path_with_orientation_and_parameters is a type of .

specifies the
for the Curve_based_path_with_orientation_and_parameters.

A Geometric_representation_context_with_parameter is a type of
with an additional parameter.
specifies an additional parameter for the Geometric_representation_context_with_parameter. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An Interpolated_configuration_representation is a type of
that specifies a motion (forward analysis) of a .
an inherited attribute that shall be of type .
an inherited attribute whose members shall be of type .

An Interpolated_configuration_segment is a specification of a single segment of an . An Interpolated_configuration_segment is defined by a
at a particular parameter value and the interpolation instruction to the next or first segment in the list.

the
the Interpolated_configuration_segment refers to.
the parameter associated to the Interpolated_configuration_segment.

the
for the Interpolated_configuration_segment.

A Interpolated_configuration_sequence is a type of
that represent a sequence of s, each consisting of a
at a particular parameter value and an interpolation type to the next or in the case of the last one to the first .

the list of Interpolated_configuration_segments for the Interpolated_configuration_sequence. There shall exist at least one
for the Interpolated_configuration_sequence.
the number of segments.
indication of whether the interpolation shall continue with the first segment after the last one is reached, resulting in a cyclic movement.

the
that is interpolated by this Interpolated_configuration_sequence.
All segments of an Interpolated_configuration_sequence shall be based on the same .

A Kinematic_path is a type of . A Kinematic_path describes a path or a segment of a path along which motion is to take place.

the list of Kinematic_path_segments for the Kinematic_path. There shall exist at least one
for the Kinematic_path.
the parameter value at the start of the Kinematic_path.
a number of segments for the Kinematic_path.

if the
of the last segment is not , then this defines a cyclic movement.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Kinematic_path_defined_by_curves. There shall exist at least one
for the Kinematic_path_defined_by_curves.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes. There shall exist at least one

for the Kinematic_path_defined_by_nodes.

A Kinematic_path_segment is either a
or a .
the parameter value at the end of the Kinematic_path_segment.

the
that defines on how to continue with the next following segment (if any).

A Linear_path is a type of . A Linear_path is an arcwise connected bounded linear path element defined by the two transforms of the Path_nodes at the beginning and the end of the path element. The transforms between the values of the motion parameters given in these Path_nodes are obtained by linear interpolation between the transforms specified in node from and node to of the Linear_path.
an inherited attribute that shall be of type which value is .

and a type of . A Link_motion_relationship describes the relation of a
with a frame on a .

which specifies a motion.

that is to be moved.

of the related
and .

in which the items are related to form a representation of some concept.

A Path_node is a type of
that is a constituent of a path definition. It consists of a linear transformation and its associated motion parameter. Each Path_node is either a , a , a , or a .
a linear transformation that specifies a local frame on a path.

A Point_to_point_path is a type of . A Point_to_point_path defines the frames which are to be traversed. It does not have a prescribed interpolation.
The interpolation is left to the software that uses the data.
an inherited attribute that shall be of type which value is .
